alert.note: Alert for Elkhart; Noble (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:47PM EST until February 20 at 7:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Ohio...Michigan... Salamonie River below Warren affecting Wabash, Huntington, Blackford, Wells and Jay Counties. Salamonie River at Portland affecting Jay County. Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Pulaski, Marshall, Fulton IN, Starke and Kosciusko Counties. Kankakee River at Davis affecting Starke, La Porte and St. Joseph IN Counties. Yellow River at Plymouth affecting Marshall, Starke and St. Joseph IN Counties. Maumee River at Napoleon affecting Henry County. Saint Marys River at St. Mary`s River near Fort Wayne affecting Allen IN County. Saint Joseph River Michigan at South Bend affecting Elkhart, Berrien and St. Joseph IN Counties. Saint Joseph River Michigan at Niles affecting Elkhart, Berrien and St. Joseph IN Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Ohio... Wabash River at Wabash affecting Cass IN, Miami and Wabash Counties. Auglaize River near Fort Jennings affecting Allen OH, Paulding and Putnam Counties. Ottawa River near Kalida affecting Putnam County. Blanchard River at Ottawa affecting Putnam County. Maumee River at Fort Wayne affecting Allen IN and Paulding Counties. Tippecanoe River above Winamac affecting Pulaski, White and Carroll Counties. Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. Wabash River near Bluffton IN affecting Wells County. Eel River at North Manchester affecting Cass IN, Miami, Wabash, Whitley and Kosciusko Counties. Auglaize River near Defiance affecting Defiance County. Maumee River near Defiance affecting Henry and Defiance Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting Allen IN, De Kalb and Defiance Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near St. Joe River Ft. Wayne affecting Allen IN County. Saint Joseph River Ohio below Montpelier affecting Williams County. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Fulton OH, Williams and Defiance Counties. Elkhart River at Goshen affecting Noble and Elkhart Counties. North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County. .The combination of snowmelt and 1 to 2 inches of rainfall led to rises on area rivers. Rises could shift ice in the river that could lead to ice jams. This forecast is based on unobstructed flow and does not factor additional rises associated with ice jams. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elkhart River at Goshen. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Several residential streets are flooded in Goshen. US 33 begins to flood. Flooding from Chicago Poke Plaza reaches residential areas near the intersection of Indiana and Berkey Avenues in Goshen. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM EST Thursday was 7.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 8.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening to 5.8 feet and begin rising again Monday morning. It will rise to 6.3 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
